Dialogue: My daughter. They have her in a van across the street. They say they'll kill her if I don't do something for them.

Dialogue: In twenty-five minutes in the California Ballroom.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: There was a woman. She was trying to help me. I watched him murder her.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: What are you supposed to do?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Kill the Governor.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: I knew I should have packed up and gone home as soon as I got that twenty. What am I supposed to do about this situation?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: One of them is in on it. He might even be in charge. Her Security is in on it. There's only one person I know for sure isn't in on it.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: The Governor. If I could just talk to her...

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Oh, Jesus ...

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: No way, there's nothing you can do to help me.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Then why'd you drag me into it?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: It's my kid. I've got to...to somehow...do right by my little girl.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: It's about time I did. I was one of those guys, workaholics. I worked my ass off for them - my wife, my daughter.  That's just what I thought I was supposed to do.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Yeah, all right, listen...

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: So when she wanted a divorce...I was...I didn't know what I'd done wrong. I didn't see it. I didn't see it....

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Why don't you tell me about the early years some other time?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: I'm sorry. You understand I don't mind dying if I could save my daughter. I mean that.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Yeah, now listen.  I can't mess with these shoes any more or it's gonna look funny. You go down get yourself something to drink. Make sure Godzilla there, follows you.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: What are you going to do?

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: I haven't the faintest idea. Go on now. I'll get word to you.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: If nothing else, someone heard my story.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Keep the change.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Don't think I won't.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: I need a drink.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Give me a ...a gingerale?

Speaker: tv reporter
Dialogue: No shit. If I hear that stop the violence routine one more time I'm going to shoot somebody.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Here's your Ginger Ale, sir.

Speaker: tv reporter
Dialogue: They're all the same.

Speaker: tv reporter
Dialogue: You know what bothers me?

Speaker: tv reporter
Dialogue: When they get all weepy eyed about the "ordinary citizen", the "regular Joe", the "normal American". Gimme a break. There ain't no such animal. We're a nation of two hundred forty million special interest groups.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Well, I'm just a regular guy.

Speaker: tv reporter
Dialogue: Is that right?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Yeah, that's right. But I've built a good solid business out of nothing. Don't underestimate the regular guy.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: Sir, you haven't paid.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: It's on the Special Interest at the end of the bar.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: Hey, Sir, don't make me call a cop.

Speaker: officer trust
Dialogue: Where is he? Did you lose him?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Let's all hope so.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Quick, off with the shoes and pants. Trade with Gustino. The big guy's coming.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: C'mon, ladies. No time to be shy.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Gustino! Drop 'em!

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: And cover up them socks. Man, who dresses you?

Speaker: janitor
Dialogue: Fue.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Meet Irene.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Irene is going to help.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Where am I going?

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: You said there was only one person you knew wasn't in on this thing.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: You're going to go see her.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: What!?

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: You sure she's asleep?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I took up extra pillows. She take a nap before her big speech.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: What am I supposed to say to her?

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: It'll come to you. See if you can stop this thing 'fore it gets started. Save us all considerable embarrassment.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Irene...?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Excuse me...

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: Who the hell are you?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: No, please.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Mrs. Grant, Governor...I won't hurt you.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: My security people are right next door.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: I appreciate that.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: One loud scream will bring them in here instantly. You won't get very far. Think it over.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: If I were here to hurt you I would have done it already.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: That's...a comfort to hear.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: I have a problem.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: Ah.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Only you can help me. I'm also sorry to say, my problem is your problem, Mrs. Grant.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: I remember you...in the elevator.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: You were very nervous.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: It was because I had this...in my pocket

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: I need you to listen to me. Carefully. Three lives depend on you listening very carefully to what I have to say.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: Of course. But suppose we set up an appointment. I have an important speech to deliver and you're cutting into my nap time.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Krista Brooks is dead.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: How do you know that?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: I saw her die. She was shot. With this gun.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: You shot her?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: Who did?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: I don't know. The only thing I know about him is that he works for your husband.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: And your husband works for somebody else.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: What the hell are you saying?

Speaker: hector
Dialogue: He's gone.

Speaker: hector
Dialogue: Hey, Gustino, what takes you so long? You need to eat more fiber.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: I knew you wouldn't believe me.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: I said I'd listen to you, not necessarily believe you. You're telling me my people are in a plot against me. You're telling me my husband wants me killed. What do you expect?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: I don't blame you. I don't have any proof. But nothing like this occurs in a vacuum. You can't be totally oblivious. You must suspect something. You're doing things which are making people angry. People who have been in power a long time are losing their jobs. You know them better than me. How much does it mean to them?  How far would they go to hang onto it?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: There's only one way to find out for sure. Try to cancel the last speech.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: I'd prefer we didn't refer to it as my last speech.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: It's the last chance they have for me to kill you. Try to get out of it. They won't let you. They can't. Try to change the schedule and you'll know I'm right. What have you got to lose? It comes down to who you trust, them or me? Test them.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: I love it when pistolero's talk of trust.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: This? I've never even fired one.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: Indeed.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: Franco! Franco.'

Speaker: franco
Dialogue: What is it, Governor!? What's wrong!?

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: I...I'm afraid I've had a bad dream, Franco.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Well?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: What are you going to do now?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: I don't know. I have to get back.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: What are you going to do!?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: This is about power and you haven't got any. There's nothing more you can do. I'm sorry. Thanks for trying.

Speaker: officer trust
Dialogue: Get moving.

Speaker: officer trust
Dialogue: It's time. It's time now.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Where are we going?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: I know what I have to do. I'll do it. Let's go.

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: Hey, El, how's the head?

Speaker: mystery man
Dialogue: Eleanor.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: Lousy. And I have siesta hair. I'm thinking of canceling the speech.

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: It's an important speech.

Speaker: mystery man
Dialogue: I'd say critical, not that it's any of my business.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: It's just another speech in a Tower of Babel so high that Nimrod himself would be put to shame. Cancel. Make my apologies.

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: Excuse me.

Speaker: mystery man
Dialogue: I'll trot along. Nice to see you, Eleanor.

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: During a campaign every speech is important. This is free media exposure. Primetime news coverage that we couldn't buy.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: What's he doing here?

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: Who, him? Just visiting.

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: He's my friend. And he did help you to get elected, after all.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: Don't remind me.

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: What happened here?

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: Nothing. I broke a lamp.

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: Eleanor, please. I'll put it this way. This speech or a half-dozen rubber chicken-fund raisers. What do you say?

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: Truth is, besides the headache I've come down with a little lower intestinal havoc. Make my apologies.

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: Come on, El, you're a trooper. I'll get you some Pepto, you'll make one of your patented tributes to the common person, then back to Sacramento. This is no time to lay down on the job. I don't care what the polls say, you can't afford to relax. Look what happened to Bush. Tell you what, if you want to blow off the Sacramento speech, fine. But do this one and we'll get out of the smog.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: All right, I'll do it.

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: That's my girl.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: But I want to make some changes. Get Krista in here right away won't you?

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: Aw, gee. I sent her on an errand.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: You sent my assistant on an errand.

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: I've been a bad boy.

Speaker: politico
Dialogue: Ladies, gentlemen, it is my great pleasure to introduce to you the esteemed spouse of our Governor. Let's give a big L.A. welcome to Mr. Brendan Grant.

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen of the press, campaign volunteers, and those of you who were looking for any excuse to take off work for the afternoon...

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: We have with us today the first woman Governor of our great state...

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: Governor Eleanor Samara Grant. What can I say about her....that won't get me in trouble when I get home tonight.

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: She's a woman who loves our great state.

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: A brilliant legislator.

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: ...who will soon win her second term as the greatest Governor California has ever seen!

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen...

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: I am honored to present to you our esteemed Governor and my beloved wife, Eleanor Samara Grant!

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: Thank you! Thank you all!

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Look out! Look out!

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Look out!

Speaker: brendan grant
Dialogue: My God, he did it!

Speaker: officer trust
Dialogue: You little son of a bitch.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: Are you all right, Franco?

Speaker: franco
Dialogue: I'd be better if they'd put sleeves on these damn vests.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Why do you keep looking at me?

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: I'm not a baby.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: I'm not a big girl but I'm not a baby.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: A surprise?

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Good afternoon, madam. Hello there, little girl.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Just giving you the gift of a clean windshield. Only cost you a dollar.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: You just think you don't want your windshield cleaned.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Don't be like that. Think of me as the Moses of dirty windshields leading you through the desert of dead bugs.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: It's already done. I've already done it. You have to pay me now.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: You're going to deny me a lousy dollar after I've sweated like a pig giving you the gift of a clean windsheild?

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: I don't think so.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: I think this is worth a dollar.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Oh, we'll have to do better than that.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Gimme a dollar.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: There's nothing like a good wing- tip.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: What time is it?

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Lost my watch.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: Any comment at this time would be most premature. Please, we'll have something for you in a couple of hours. Please...

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: I...1 would like to...thank you, Mister Wat... Gene.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: I would also like to apologize.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: For what?

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: For not believing you.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Believe me, I don't blame you.  This is the Governor, Lynn. Say hello.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: You have a very brave father, Lynn.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: He's a hero.

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: Yes, yes he is.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Dads are like that.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Can we go now?

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: Of course. I'll get a car to drive you.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: No, that's... That's OK. We don't need any help. We'll be just fine. Won't we, Lynn?

Speaker: eleanor grant
Dialogue: Good luck.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Same to you.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Thanks for the shine.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Thanks for the tip.

Speaker: gene
Dialogue: Come on, kid. I gotta make a phone call.

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: Kisses to you.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: No, kisses to you!

Speaker: huey
Dialogue: No, kisses to you.
